question: While determining the coefficient of viscosity of the given liquid, a spherical steel ball sinks by a distance <katex>$h=0.9m$</katex>. The radius of the ball <katex>$r=\sqrt{3} \times 10^{-3}m$</katex>. The time taken by the ball to sink in three trails are tabulated as follows: 2.75s, 2.65s, 2.70s. The difference between the densities of the steel ball and the liquid is <katex>$7000 kg m^{-3}$</katex>. If <katex>$g=10ms^{-2}$</katex>, then the coefficient of viscosity of the given liquid at room temperature is
